On Mar 8, 2008, at 12:04 AM, Kenneth Stanley wrote:

> Colin, this issue is outside my expertise but I agree that (I think)
> patterns in the sequences shouldn't really matter for the purposes of
> NEAT.  There is no a priori reason to believe that the pattern is any
> more or less beneficial than something without a pattern


That said.. there's really no reason not to use a good PRNG.
